CatDescriptText: Mr. William Powell, 159 E. Lemington Street, Penn HIlls, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "That's a hard question to answer. IN the past, I didn't approve of women working in bars, but today, the way it is, some women make better bartenders and give better service than men."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Powell, wearing hat, eyeglasses, dark shirt, and tweed jacket, standing on Liberty Avenue with May Building in background
